Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • HumanPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlayerInterface

    public class HumanPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlayerInterface
    A human player that takes user input and makes the move.
    Author:
    Steven Lowes

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public MoveInterface makeMove(Piece[][] boardView)
                       throws NoValidMovesException
        Asks the player to make a move, and returns it once made
        Specified by:
        makeMove in interface PlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        boardView - the current state of the board
        Returns:
        The move that the human player wishes to make. Contains either coordinates or a concession.
        Throws:
        NoValidMovesException - There's nowhere on the board left to go - no locations are equal to Piece.UNSET

      • finalGameState

        public boolean finalGameState(GameState state)
        Inform the user of the final game state.
        Specified by:
        finalGameState in interface PlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        state - either WON or LOST.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful completion.

      • setColour

        public boolean setColour(Piece colour)
                  throws InvalidColourException,
                         ColourAlreadySetException
        Update the colour of the player.
        Specified by:
        setColour in interface PlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        colour - A Piece (RED/BLUE) that this player will be.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful operation.
        Throws:
        InvalidColourException - New colour is neither Piece.RED or Piece.BLUE.
        ColourAlreadySetException - Player already has a colour defined.

      • getColour

        public Piece getColour()
        Returns:
        Colour of player as Piece value.
